feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - API change for OS reinstallation
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 10, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

May 22, 22:51 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our API offer.

This will affect some functionality.

Start time : 10/09/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 10/09/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, API will stop to accept SSH key id for OS reinstallation.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - IPXE scripts migration
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 9, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

Jun 27, 22:22 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our IPXE scripts.

Start time : 09/07/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 09/07/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy about IPXE (open-source implementation of the Preboot eXecution Environment), the following API calls will be definitely removed: POST /me/ipxeScript PUT /me/ipxeScript/{name} Customers can still use that feature by using the "bootScript" key within the PUT /dedicated/server/{serviceName} API call: see documentation for more details.

If you have never used the OVHcloud API, then you can ignore this message since this feature is not and has never been available in the OVHcloud control panel.
If you don't know what iPXE script is, then you are probably not affected by this change.

In the past months, we have simplified the API call format used to boot a server from a custom iPXE script: see documentation.

If your server was still configured to boot from iPXE scripts in the old location, we have already moved the script to the new location. You don't need to reboot your server. Except if you change the boot mode in the meantime, next time the server will reboot it will be completely smooth and automatically boot from that new location.

Starting from 9th of July 2024 we are going to remove the remaining API calls of the old location under /me/ipxeScript. After this date you will no longer be able to access the scripts stored under that old location and they will definitely removed.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - API call removal
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 3, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

May 28, 22:23 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our API.

The 03th of July 2024, the following API call will be definitely removed:
GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/templateCapabilities

Start time : 03/07/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 03/07/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : This API call was previously useful for old Windows OS installers that were not compatible with installation on another diskgroup on servers with multiple diskgroups.
Since then all OSes can be installed on any diskgroup.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - iPXE script boot migration
entry.content:
Jun 26, 08:26 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jun 25, 15:52 UTC
Update - Operations on this service have been extended.
Please find below the new end time:
End time : 26/06/2024 08:00 UTC
Service impact : None

Jun 25, 13:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

May 22, 22:14 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our iPXE API offer.

If you have never used the OVHcloud API, then you can ignore this message since this feature is not and has never been available in the OVHcloud control panel.

In the past months, we have simplified the API call format used to boot a server from a custom iPXE script: see documentation.

Start time : 25/06/2024 13:00 UTC
End time : 25/06/2024 13:15 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : If your server is still configured to boot from iPXE scripts in the old location, starting from 25th of June 2024 we will change it to the new location under the bootScript attribute for the affected dedicated servers.
You don't need to reboot your server. Next time the server will reboot it will be completely smooth and automatically boot from iPXE script in new location.
